intro: Cyanicula nikulinskyae, commonly known as the Nikulinsky's bluebell, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue-violet bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Cyanicula nikulinskyae is considered a species of conservation concern.
